Articles.Content: Using the [Damned Aerospace Helicopter Unit](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=10138.0) and the [Damned Robotics Parts](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=10662.0) build a helicopter that can airlift at least any 2 connected target parts. Must have at least a screen shot showing the helicopter in flight carrying the target, preferably a video of the actual grab and lift.
This looks like a sweet challenge.

Here is a proof-of-concept and my first entry:

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/fhMAefpes04?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

> 
> Here is a proof-of-concept and my first entry:
> 
> -snip-

I think you\'ve won the challenge.
I\'m sure someone can make something both more effective and more esthetically pleasing.
Can we get a video of you dropping the thing you picked up? =P
Pffft, who need a mod part pack to make a claw? I made one in vanilla! [http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=12633.0](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=12633.0)

So has everyone, Lazer, but the Landing Struts are puny babies compared to the robust manliness of the DA claw. 

Awesome design, SasquatchM!

Here is the first heli setting the target on top of the space plane building. Hopefully this counts as dropping.

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/l-hRagKnNnQ?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Wow.

Also, I may design a version of *Seahawk Rescue* as a helicopter. I had been trying to construct a VTOL plane version, but it was just too massive. Especially considering this version had a passenger cabin for rescuing survivors.
